title: Ohms law - I-V data graph up to 3 mA at 5 V

content.question: A resistor is connected to a variable source of potential difference. A group of students take measurements of the potential difference <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mstyle></math> across and current in a resistor for different settings of the source of potential difference. A graph of the students’ data is shown in the figure. Which of the following will best determine the resistance of the resistor?

choices.label: Calculate the area under a best-fit line between the lowest and highest <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> values.
Calculate the areas under line segments that connect adjacent data points. Add the areas together.
Calculate the slope of a best-fit line to the data. Take the inverse of the slope.

Calculate the slope of the line connecting the points with the lowest and highest <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> values. Take the inverse of the slope.

content.answer: Calculate the slope of a best-fit line to the data. Take the inverse of the slope.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
